title: AT&T Peering Coming Online!
body:
We have made big improvements for AT&T players! Recently, we've reached an agreement with AT&T that should improve connections and help lower ping. To explain what's going on, let's break this down into what occurred before and what will happen now:

#***Before:***

As a player using AT&T, your connection to LoL game servers in Chicago would enter AT&T's network but there was a good chance that your connection would pass through another 3rd party network before making its way to the game servers. This would cause some inefficient pathing and could result in higher than normal ping.

#***After:***

With our agreement with AT&T, when playing League of Legends your connection shouldn't pass through extraneous networks. The result will be a more direct path to our game servers.

#***So...What Does This Mean?***

Beyond a more efficient path and hopefully lower ping, it's much easier for our teams here to identify and troubleshoot issues where players are getting poor ping or inefficient paths. Additionally, once we get AT&T connected to our various [Points-of-Presence](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/hXxTbpiI-na-server-roadmap-south-bridge-update) (PoPs) across North America (currently, Los Angeles, Dallas, Atlanta, San Jose), we will get connections onto Riots Direct Network even faster, giving your connection a highway directly to LoL game servers. We're working to AT&T to get them connected to our PoPs in the near future.

We aren't expecting players to have any issues after these changes, but if you do have problems connecting while on AT&T or suddenly have much higher ping, reply to this thread and confirm your ISP, as well as your location. Our Network team will be keeping an eye on this thread and respond to any concerns.

Hey guys, just want you to know that we see this thread and aren't ignoring you guys that are having issues.  We are looking into this and will update you guys when we have more information.  It may just be like Korensky posted a few days ago that the routing is going to be a little suboptimal until we finish peering with AT&T.

Really appreciate your patience as we try to get this stuff as good as we can for everyone.

Hey guys, just want you to know that we are watching this thread.  We are looking into this and will update you guys when we have more information.  It may just be like Korensky posted a few days ago that the routing is going to be a little suboptimal until we finish peering with AT&T.

Really appreciate your patience as we try to get this stuff as good as we can for everyone.

This will be the third time I have posted on this thread. I have been getting ping over 30 higher than what it was BEFORE the peering. I have said this twice now with no answer back, and I'm just getting increasingly frustrated by the lack of response. It was 50 after the server move and after the peering it has been at 75-80 with constant and random spikes. I would really like some feedback on how to fix this please.
My ping is back to 38-40 which is good, but when I ping the 104.160.131.1 server IP address in command prompt, it gives me like 28-30 ms, after the partnering.  Why is this?

I was getting around 40ping, then it went to 60, then they did the peering, and it went back to 40, but now is 60 again. lol   I guess they are working on it, hopefully I get it down to 40 or lower, for good...

was around 80 for me but now I get spikes to 1000-2000 forcing the game to disconnect
only remedy was the close the client which normalized the ping
and it continues to happen each game

The past few days my ping has been abysmal.  Before it would be at a constant 35 (from Michigan) and the past week or so it's been fluctuating from 100 to as high as 3000 ping in my last game, where it was fluctuating ridiculously.  I've been checking to see if AT&T itself has just been bad lately, but when I run speedtest I have normal decent scores in all categories.  

These huge increases of ping have not been uncommon and i've had very few, if any, games without at least a few stretches where it goes to 300+ for a few seconds.  I'm not sure if it is the new peering thing or something else (i'm not sure exactly when this all started) but I can't really play at the moment.

Hi Folks,

Just wanted to update those of you from AT&T who have seen your ping go up slightly. Right now with only two points of interconnect running, it means that traffic will be pulled towards the closest one of those. Currently those points are Chicago and Dallas. This means if you're in Southern California, you will be on a slightly longer geographic path as traffic will go to Dallas first before crossing over from the AT&T network into Riot Games.

The other locations are coming up very soon. We are making progress with the team over at AT&T every day and hope to be able to update this thread soon with some more specific details.

For those of you who have seen an increase in ping time, can you let us know how the general gameplay has been in terms of ping stability and packet loss? If you can let us know the region you're playing from as well it'll help us take a closer look at anything that may not be working as intended.

Korensky

I was told by Wuks to paste the Information here about my ping being a lot higher than normal. You can view the original thread here:

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/YMi7lYOo-dont-think-its-only-texas-riot?comment=000000000000

Yea something is just not right. I'm in central Cali with At&t. When they moved from Portland to Chicago I went from 56 to 84 ping but it was a solid 84 and that never moved. The day this thread was created I actually went up to 86 which wasnt a big deal although strange since it was suppose to be an improvement. Then a few days later when the pops in LA were up and suppose to help more I went up again to 88 ping... Now today it has once again gone up to 91.  When I posted my tracert riot said I was connecting correctly but ive been getting worse every day since the improvements.
Why am I lagging today? It's been ridiculous

Ping went up 40ms.
Used to sit at a cozy 60ms, now I can barely CS at a whopping 100ms.

My ping has increased to 104-105 today. Since the move to Chicago, I was averaging 69-74 ping. Why is there a sudden increase in my ping? I live near Miami, FL.

A couple questions anout this:
1. Will it decrease ping from ATT hotspots (mobile phone hotspots in particular) 
2. Same for verizon
3. Are there any plans to implement peering for T-mobile? I used to play league from home on my phone internet, but ever since the server move I have been driving 45 minutes to my cousin's house every day to play since ping isn't good on my phone anymore.

Hey everyone!

Just a quick update.  We have brought the Peering with AT&T in LA online this morning.  Please let me know how things are looking for you now.  Initial internal tests are showing some people (especially close to the LA area) should have about a 10ms drop in ping.

We are still working hard with AT&T to bring other locations online and really appreciate everyone's patience while we go through this process.

Thanks!

Las
